author: Queentoshi
created_time: May 29, 2022, 09:18:51 AMLast edit: May 29, 2022, 09:32:44 AM by Queentoshi
content: Binance has an exciting feature where users of binance alone can send and receive crypto for free via a unique Payment Identification Number (Pay ID). It is fast, free as they have said and very efficient, I have tried out this feature.How to get your Pay ID.(1) Click "more" option on the home page of your binance.(2) Scroll down to "Pay" under the "Finance" option. A page with your unique PAY ID number, and a "send" and "Receive" option will be displayed. You can send crypto to another binance user with the "send" option, you will be required to input the receiver's unique Pay ID. There's an option for ease where you can easily scan a unique QRcode from the receiver. After inputting the PAY ID of the receiver, it is a simple process from there on.On the "Receive" option, if you want to receive crypto from another binance user via this method, when you click receive, a unique qrcode which can be scanned will come up alongside your PAY ID, you can easily copy and send to the sender.I hope this method will be useful to someone here, I've tried adding screenshots to make this simple guide more explanatory, but i noticed it is not displaying, how do I go about it?

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: If I’m not wrong, TX transfers between two Binance accounts were already free using the regular withdraw methods, providing the recipient was also a Binance account (read through https://www.binance.com/en/support/faq/360037037312).This appears to be an additional alternative method, that is a subset of Binance Pay, which gives the end user a bit more play with the QR codes and so on.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Findingnemo on May 29, 2022, 01:14:15 PMWell, its actually not a transaction since nothing is happening on chain probably we can just call it as transfer and there is no wonder that we can do for free but anyway thanks for the steps because I didn't know the feature exist in Binance but used the feature in coinbase not anymore.It's actually the same on any local exchange wallet, actually, that is not on-chain and it's not recorded and reflected in the public ledger. This means the transaction that was made can be validated in a public ledger while off-chain was not.  That's why the transaction fee has a low cost or is totally zero.Good to know that Binance adopted this feature, it will really help those small traders that wanted to save fees.
